column2: In a fiat money system like ours the government can always 'fund' its programs, no matter how much or little the government taxes.
column3: Legal tax avoidance by multinationals must be addressed as a matter of priority. This revenue could ensure wealth was paying its fair share.
column4: Consideration of the "fairness" of tax needs to include the full tax and transfer system - that is why we have benefits and WFF.
column5: Company income tax is only 16% of the total tax take. Changes should be made to increase this, particularly from multi-national companies
column6: All taxes should be structured so the more you earn the more you pay. No tax should be regressive like GST.
column7: Our income tax is some of the lowest in the OECD and this has lead to under-funding of services needed by low income families.
column8: Create a directory of foreign owned trusts to prevent the $1.35bn of money laundered in NZ each year http://bit.ly/transparencyNZ
column9: Taxes should be used to prevent inflation and inequality
column10: The government should work much harder to reel in the estimated $2bn of tax fraud each year. http://bit.ly/taxfraud2014
column11: Reduce income tax to 10% flat and increase GST, taxing on consumption is fairer and also taxes under the table and black market economy.
